The National Weather Service has issued an Extreme Cold Warning from 6 p.m. Jan. 24 until 12 p.m. Jan. 26 and a Winter Storm Warning from 6 a.m. Jan. 24 until 12 p.m. Jan. 25 for Hays County.

Mayor and Council

Kyle City Council

Kyle City Council is composed of seven elected officials: the mayor and six city council members. Three council members are elected at-large (Districts 1, 3, and 5), and three are elected by district (Districts 2, 4, and 6); all serve staggered three-year terms. The mayor is elected at-large and serves a three-year term.

Regular City Council meetings are held on the 1st and 3rd Tuesdays at 7 p.m. at Kyle City Hall, 100 W. Center Street.

The City Council welcomes comments from Citizens early in the agenda of meetings. Those wishing to speak are encouraged to sign in before the meeting begins. Speakers may be provided with an opportunity to speak during this time period on any agenda item or any other matter concerning city business, and they must observe the three-minute time limit.

If you are unable to attend a council meeting and would like to send feedback to the Kyle City Council, residents can  email CouncilFeedback@cityofkyle.com or leave a recorded voice message at 737-256-7508. All emails and voice messages will be distributed to Kyle City Council Members. Individual Council Member contact information can be found in their bios below.

The Kyle City Charter provides that City Council may determine and define the rule of its proceedings and require certain decorum it deems necessary to properly transact the business of the city via the Rules of Council .
